meta.content: Corrections; Books; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

abstract.p: Correction of July 27 review of book Liberace: An American Boy, which included imprecise attribution from book

block.p: A book review on Thursday about ''Liberace: An American Boy,'' by Darden Asbury Pyron, included an imprecise attribution from the book for a comment supposedly made by the pianist in the face of an adverse review. It was a 1954 TV Guide article about Liberace that quoted him as saying he had ''laughed all the way to the bank.'' (Bartlett's Familiar Quotations, cited elsewhere in the biography, is the source for a different version of the remark -- from Liberace's 1973 autobiography: ''I cried all the way to the bank.'')

A book review on Thursday about ''Liberace: An American Boy,'' by Darden Asbury Pyron, included an imprecise attribution from the book for a comment supposedly made by the pianist in the face of an adverse review. It was a 1954 TV Guide article about Liberace that quoted him as saying he had ''laughed all the way to the bank.'' (Bartlett's Familiar Quotations, cited elsewhere in the biography, is the source for a different version of the remark -- from Liberace's 1973 autobiography: ''I cried all the way to the bank.'')
